basics.name: Jan-Erik Karlsson
basics.label: First line IT-suppport
basics.summary: Currently on study leave from work, studying to become a Java programmer.

work.summary:
First line IT-support in the Bjuv Municipality IT department. As such I've answered the support hotline and replying to support cases via e-mail. My work has been mainly in-office, but occasionally doing work outside of the office.

I've developed a Word-course as well as a host of internal apps for various departments and use, such as an ordering system consisting of four apps, course booking system of two apps and more.

In May 2018 the IT-departments of four small and neighbouring municipalities merged and my employer changed from Bjuvs kommun to Klippans kommun, together with all the colleagues of the IT-department.
Making cold calls to people and small businesses in Sweden, making bookings for meetings with financial advisers.

At first English teacher for the staff, and then in June of 2012 I moved to the premises to live and work as a full time manager.

The work encompassed everything a small resort needs: to lead the work with the local staff, check in and take care of guests, bake and cook, do maintenance repairs or make sure it got taken care of, looking after all the dogs living at the resort, and occasionally taking guests on tours.

Furthermore kept the accounts in a big Excel spreadsheet.

Lived next door to and took care of the small family run NGO KSDP.

Made sure all the local projects got their money on time, and kept the accounts.

Also held two office skills and Microsoft Office training courses for students from the nearby refugee camp and Kayah (longneck) villages.
English evening course with the local staff at IOM's Mae Hong Son office.
English teacher for the local staff of the TBC (formerly TBBC) NGO in Mae Hong Son.
Wrote programs for ABB Industrial robots, mostly in use in the automotive business.
Event staff/marketer in supermarkets around Västerås.
Datorteket was a government program for unemployed people, where a big part of my job was to inspire and help clients when looking for a job.
Installation of an IP-based phone system.
The job was to teach music to seven and nine graders at a big public school in Västerås, and to be the home teacher for one class.

IT-consultant with one assignment at AerotechTelub, Arboga.

Programming languages used: C and Visual Basic.

IT consultant and teacher.

Special assignments for Semcon:
•	Participant in the conference JavaPlus, San Jose California, 2000
•	Participant in IACS Conference on “Systems, Man and Cybernetics” in San Diego USA. 

During my five years as a consultant I had many different assignments, always working in a close relationship with the customer. I also was a teacher in several programming workshops and courses (C and Java) ; I developed the course material myself.

Various tools and programming languages used: C, Visual Basic, Visual Basic for Applications, Java, HTML, and did some tests in C++.

I worked as a programmer in the medical sector, working mainly on PC Medical's own archiving and diagnosis tools for x-ray machines and other image producing hospital equipment.

We worked in C for WIndows.

Co-owner and programmer. We developed a system for doctors with private clinics to keep track of all the patient images in procedures like arthroscopy and colonoscopy.

We worked in Borland Pascal for Windows, using BTrieve as database.

Software developer, working mainly on Promed, an administrative tool for private doctors, keeping case files, making appointments. We worked on a similar system for dentists, Prodent.

We worked in Turbo Pascal, MD-DOS, using BTrieve as a relational database.

As well as being lead programmer, I also helped developing the handbooks and training courses, and oftentimes did the basic training when the system was installed in a private practices.
I paid for my driving license by being a paper boy for the newspaper Kvällsposten, having my own district, going door to door to sell papers.

volunteer.summary: Living with a Nepali family in a small mountain village outside of Pokhara, I taught English and computers in the little private school the family was running.

I've been to Denjong Pema Choeling Academy, or DPCA twice, the first time in 2007. 

I lived in the monastery where the founding monk lives, and was teaching mostly English to the students at the boarding school/orphanage.

Before coming back for a second visit in October 2008, I had raised enough money in Sweden arranging a poetry slam evening to be able to buy a cow with a calf so the children could get milk two or three times a week. Second visit was shorter, only three weeks.
Link Hands for Humanity’s field officer in the area, making payments on their behalf to their local projects.

volunteer.organization: Huay Pu Keng Kayah (longneck) village, Mae Hong Son
volunteer.summary: Did a biofuel briquette training, teaching how to collect, prepare and press materials to make a firewood replacement briquette.

volunteer.organization: PaO Women's Union, Mae Hong Son
volunteer.summary:
In October 2011 I held a successful biomass briquette project with PaO Women’s Union outside Mae Hong Son.

When they didn't have any other volunteers, I helped out teaching their members English.

volunteer.organization: Ban Nai Soi Community Learning Center
volunteer.summary:
I volunteered at CLC twice; the first time at the end of my first long trip to Asia, from December 2011 to February 2012.

The second time I stayed a full semester, from May until October 2009.

I was mostly teaching English, but also some Community Development and Burmese history.
